summary:
The Security Council,
 Condemns the terrorist bomb attack at the Paradise Hotel in Kikambala, Kenya, and the attempted missile attack on Arkia Israeli Airlines flight 582 on 28 November 2002, regarding such acts as a threat to international peace and security. 
Expresses deepest sympathy to the people and Governments of Kenya and Israel and to the victims and their families. 
Urges all States to cooperate in efforts to find and bring to justice the perpetrators, organizers and sponsors of these terrorist attacks, in accordance with their obligations under resolution 1373 (2001). 
Expresses its reinforced determination to combat all forms of terrorism, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter of the United Nations.
